text:
There is no formal proposal for prenatal sex determination and the idea is at the discussion stage, Union Women and Child Development Minister Maneka Gandhi clarified here on Tuesday amid a raging debate over her remark that such a test be made compulsory to check female foeticide.

“The Minister clarifies that there is no Cabinet proposal for tracking the sex of a foetus and that compulsory determination of foetal sex is an idea given by some stakeholders,” the Ministry tweeted.

Ms. Gandhi said in Jaipur on Monday: “In my personal view, the woman should be compulsorily told whether it is a boy or girl child whom she is going to give birth to. I am just putting out this idea. It is being discussed though there is no conclusion yet.”

Move comes in for flak

The Minister’s suggestion evoked sharp reaction from activists and netizens as it would result in lifting of the ban on prenatal sex determination under the PCPNDT Act. — PTI
title: No Cabinet move to track sex of foetus: Ministry
